$comment: Abstract definition of a collection of Jobs/CronJobs. Each generated Job/CronJob must include the fields `'name`, `image`, `namespace`, and `schedule`. When a python implementation of >v4 of the json schema draft is available use of`allOf` should be replaced with `merge`.

jobs.comment: An array of jobs that will inherit, and can override, properties from the top level and `namespaceOverrides`.

namespaces.comment: An array of namespaces for which to generate jobs. Each namespace here will result in the generation of a job that is identical in all aspects but namespace

namespaceOverrides.comment: An object mapping namespaces to a set of properties given a generated job belongs to the specified namespace.

job.comment: Abstract definition of a single job/cron job

env.comment: `env` in generated container specs. Values specified in the top level, `namespaceOverrides`, and `jobs` will be concatenated.

labelKey.comment: Used as a key in `labels`, where the value is specified by `name`, within object metadata for generated pod template, job, and cron job specs. Values specified in the top level, `namespaceOverrides`, and `jobs` will be concatenated separated by dashes.

name.comment: `name` in metadata for generated job and cron job specs. Also used as a label value (see `labelKey`).

namespace.comment: `namespace` in metadata for generated job and cron job specs.

schedule.comment: Dictates that this should be a cron job if a valid Cron format is given - `schedule` in the generated cron job specs. Dictates that this should be a job if the string "once" is given.
